member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmNode
member.summary: The class XdmNode represents a Node in the XDM Data Model. A Node is an XdmItem, and is therefore an XdmValue in its own right, and may also participate as one item within a sequence value.

remarks.para: An XdmNode is implemented as a wrapper around an object of type net.sf.saxon.NodeInfo. Because this is a key interface within Saxon, it is exposed via this API, even though it is a Java interface that is not part of the API proper.

The XdmNode interface exposes basic properties of the node, such as its name, its string value, and its typed value. Navigation to other nodes is supported through a single method, EnumerateAxis, which allows other nodes to be retrieved by following any of the XPath axes.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.IsAtomic
member.summary: Determine whether the item is an atomic value
member.returns: false (the item is not an atomic value)

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.getUnderlyingXmlNode
member.summary: Unwraps the underlying XmlNode object from the XdmValue. If the method does not wrap a XmlNode then a null is returned
member.returns: The underlying XmlNode

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.GetAttributeValue(Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Get a the string value of a named attribute of this element.
member.remarks: Returns null if this node is not an element, or if this element has no attribute with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the attribute whose value is required

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.GetAttributeValue(System.String)
member.summary: Get a the string value of a named attribute (in no namespace) of this element.
member.remarks: Returns null if this node is not an element, or if this element has no attribute with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the attribute whose value is required, interpreted as no-namespace name

member.summary: Get a IEnumerable of XdmNodes by applying a Step to this XdmNode value.

member.returns: an IEnumerable of nodes obtained by applying the Step function to this node

member.param: the predicate to be applied
member.returns: an Iterable containing those nodes found on the child axis that satisfy the supplied predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Children
member.summary: Get the element children of this node
member.returns: an Iterable containing all nodes on the child axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Children(System.String)
member.summary: Get the element children of this node having a specified local name, irrespective of the namespace
member.param: the local name of the child elements to be selected, or "*" to select all children that are element nodes
member.returns: an Iterable containing the element children of this node that have the required local name.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Children(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the element children having a specified namespace URI and local name
member.param: the namespace URI of the child elements to be selected: supply a zero-length string to indicate the null namespace
the local name of the child elements to be selected
member.returns: an Iterable containing the element children of this node that have the required local name and namespace URI.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.EnumerableOverAxis(Saxon.Api.XdmAxis)
member.summary: Get an enumerable that supplies all the nodes on one of the XPath axes, starting with this node.
member.param: The axis to be navigated, for example XdmAxis.Child for the child axis.
member.remarks: The nodes are returned in axis order: that is, document order for a forwards axis, reverse document order for a reverse axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.EnumerateAxis(Saxon.Api.XdmAxis)
member.summary: Get an enumerator that supplies all the nodes on one of the XPath axes, starting with this node.
member.param: The axis to be navigated, for example XdmAxis.Child for the child axis.
member.remarks: The nodes are returned in axis order: that is, document order for a forwards axis, reverse document order for a reverse axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.EnumerateAxis(Saxon.Api.XdmAxis,Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Get an enumerator that selects all the nodes on one of the XPath axes, provided they have a given name. The nodes selected are those of the principal node kind (elements for most axes, attributes for the attribute axis, namespace nodes for the namespace axis) whose name matches the name given in the second argument.
member.param: The axis to be navigated, for example XdmAxis.Child for the child axis.
The name of the required nodes, for example new QName("", "item") to select nodes with local name "item", in no namespace.
member.remarks: The nodes are returned in axis order: that is, document order for a forwards axis, reverse document order for a reverse axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.WriteTo(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Send the node (that is, the subtree rooted at this node) to an XmlWriter
member.remarks: Note that an XmlWriter can only handle a well-formed XML document. This method will therefore signal an exception if the node is a document node with no children, or with more than one element child.
member.param: The XmlWriter to which the node is to be written

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Two instances of XdmNode are equal if they represent the same node. That is, the Equals() method returns the same result as the XPath "is" operator.
member.param: The object node to be compared

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.GetHashCode
member.summary: The hash code of a node reflects the equality relationship: if two XdmNode instances represent the same node, then they have the same hash code

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.ToString
member.summary: Return a string representation of the node.
member.remarks: This method returns the value of the property. To get the string value of a node as defined in XPath, use the property.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.NodeName
member.summary: The name of the node, as a QName. Returns null in the case of unnamed nodes.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.NodeKind
member.summary: The kind of node, as an instance of System.Xml.XmlNodeType.
member.remarks: For a namespace node in the XDM model, the value XmlNodeType.None is returned.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.LineNumber
member.summary: Get the line number of the node in a source document.
member.remarks: For a document constructed using the document builder, this is available only if the line numbering option was set when the document was built (and then only for element nodes). If the line number is not available, the value -1 is returned. Line numbers will typically be as reported by a SAX parser; this means that the line number for an element node is the line number containing the closing ">" of the start tag.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.ColumnNumber
member.summary: Get the column number of the node in a source document.
member.remarks: For a document constructed using the document builder, this is available only if the line numbering option was set when the document was built (and then only for element nodes). If the column number is not available, the value -1 is returned. Line numbers will typically be as reported by a SAX parser; this means that the column number for an element node is the column number containing the closing ">" of the start tag.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.TypedValue
member.summary: The typed value of the node, as an instance of XdmValue.
member.remarks: A DynamicError is thrown if the node has no typed value, as will be the case for an element with element-only content.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Processor
member.summary: Get a suitable for use with this .

remarks.para: In most cases this will be the original object used to create the that built the document that contains this node. If that is not available, it will be a compatible Processor, one that shares the same underlying , and hence is initialized with the same configuration settings, schema components, license features, and so on.

para.i: Note: the only case where the original Processor is not available is when the same Configuration is used with multiple APIs, for example mixing s9api and JAXP or XQJ in the same application.

member.returns: Returns a Processor suitable for performing further operations on this node, for example for creating a or an .

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.StringValue
member.summary: Get the string value of the node.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Parent
member.summary: Get the parent of this node.
member.remarks: Returns either a document node, an element node, or null in the case where this node has no parent.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Root
member.summary: Get the root of the tree containing this node.
member.remarks: Returns the root of the tree containing this node (which might be this node itself).

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.BaseUri
member.summary: Get the base URI of the node.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.DocumentUri
member.summary: Get the document URI of the node.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.OuterXml
member.summary: Return a serialization of this node as lexical XML

remarks.para: In the case of an element node, the result will be a well-formed XML document serialized as defined in the W3C XSLT/XQuery serialization specification, using options method="xml", indent="yes", omit-xml-declaration="yes".

In the case of a document node, the result will be a well-formed XML document provided that the document node contains exactly one element child, and no text node children. In other cases it will be a well-formed external general parsed entity.
In the case of an attribute node, the output is a string in the form name="value". The name will use the original namespace prefix.
Other nodes, such as text nodes, comments, and processing instructions, are represented as they would appear in lexical XML.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Implementation
member.summary: Escape hatch to the underlying class in the Java implementation

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmEmptySequence
member.summary: The class XdmEmptySequence represents an empty sequence in the XDM Data Model.

remarks.para: An empty sequence may also be represented by an XdmValue whose length happens to be zero. Applications should therefore not test to see whether an object is an instance of this class in order to decide whether it is empty.
In interfaces that expect an XdmItem, an empty sequence is represented by a CLI null value.

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.XdmEmptySequence.INSTANCE
member.summary: The singular instance of this class

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.QName
member.summary: The QName class represents an instance of xs:QName, as defined in the XPath 2.0 data model. Internally, it has three components, a namespace URI, a local name, and a prefix. The prefix is intended to be used only when converting the value back to a string.
member.remarks: Note that a QName is not itself an XdmItem in this model; however it can be converted to an XdmAtomicValue.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a QName representing a name in no namespace
member.remarks: This constructor does not check that the components of the QName are lexically valid.
member.param: The local part of the name

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct a QName using a namespace URI and a lexical representation. The lexical representation may be a local name on its own, or it may be in the form prefix:local-name
member.remarks: This constructor does not check that the components of the QName are lexically valid.
member.param: The namespace URI. Use either the string "" or null for names that are not in any namespace.
Either the local part of the name, or the prefix and local part in the format prefix:local

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct a QName using a namespace prefix, a namespace URI, and a local name (in that order).
member.remarks: This constructor does not check that the components of the QName are lexically valid.
member.param: The namespace URI. Use either the string "" or null for names that are not in any namespace.
The local part of the name

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.String,Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Construct a QName from a lexical QName, supplying an element node whose in-scope namespaces are to be used to resolve any prefix contained in the QName.

remarks.para: This constructor checks that the components of the QName are lexically valid.
If the lexical QName has no prefix, the name is considered to be in the default namespace, as defined by xmlns="...".

member.param: The lexical QName, in the form prefix:local or simply local.
The element node whose in-scope namespaces are to be used to resolve the prefix part of the lexical QName.
member.exception: If the prefix of the lexical QName is not in scope
If the lexical QName is invalid (for example, if it contains invalid characters)

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName)
member.summary: Construct a QName from an XmlQualifiedName (as defined in the System.Xml package).
member.remarks: Note that an XmlQualifiedName does not contain any prefix, so the result will always have a prefix of ""
member.param: The XmlQualifiedName

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.FromClarkName(System.String)
member.summary: Factory method to construct a QName from a string containing the expanded QName in Clark notation, that is, {uri}local
member.remarks: The prefix part of the QName will be set to an empty string.
member.param: The URI in Clark notation: {uri}local if the name is in a namespace, or simply local if not.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.FromEQName(System.String)
member.summary: Factory method to construct a QName from a string containing the expanded QName in EQName notation, that is, Q{uri}local
member.remarks: The prefix part of the QName will be set to an empty string.
member.param: The QName in EQName notation: Q{uri}local. For a name in no namespace, either of the forms Q{}local or simply local are accepted.
member.returns: the QName corresponding to the supplied name in EQName notation. This will always have an empty prefix.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.Register(Saxon.Api.Processor)
member.summary: Register a QName with the Processor. This makes comparison faster when the QName is compared with others that are also registered with the Processor. Depreacted method.
member.remarks: A given QName object can only be registered with one Processor.
member.param: The Processor in which the name is to be registered.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.IsValid(Saxon.Api.Processor)
member.summary: Validate the QName against the XML 1.0 or XML 1.1 rules for valid names.
member.param: This argument is no longer used (at one time it was used to establish whether XML 1.0 or XML 1.1 rules should be used for validation, but the two versions of the XML specification have since been aligned).
member.returns: true if the name is valid, false if not

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.IsValid
member.summary: Validate the QName against the XML rules for valid names.
member.returns: true if the name is valid, false if not

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.ToString
member.summary: Convert the value to a string. The resulting string is the lexical form of the QName, using the original prefix if there was one.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.GetHashCode
member.summary: Get a hash code for the QName, to support equality matching. This supports the semantics of equality, which considers only the namespace URI and local name, and not the prefix.
member.remarks: The algorithm for allocating a hash code does not depend on registering the QName with the Processor.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Test whether two QNames are equal. This supports the semantics of equality, which considers only the namespace URI and local name, and not the prefix.
member.param: The value to be compared with this QName. If this value is not a QName, the result is always false. Otherwise, it is true if the namespace URI and local name both match.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.ToXmlQualifiedName
member.summary: Convert the value to an XmlQualifiedName (as defined in the System.Xml package)
member.remarks: Note that this loses the prefix.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.Prefix
member.summary: Get the prefix of the QName. This plays no role in operations such as comparison of QNames for equality, but is retained (as specified in XPath) so that a string representation can be reconstructed.
member.remarks: Returns the zero-length string in the case of a QName that has no prefix.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.Uri
member.summary: Get the namespace URI of the QName. Returns "" (the zero-length string) if the QName is not in a namespace.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.LocalName
member.summary: Get the local part of the QName

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.ClarkName
member.summary: Get the expanded name, as a string using the notation devised by James Clark. If the name is in a namespace, the resulting string takes the form {uri}local. Otherwise, the value is the local part of the name.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.EQName
member.summary: Get the expanded name in EQName format, that is Q{uri}local. A no namespace name is returned as Q{}local.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.IPredicate`1
member.summary: Interface that represents a predicate (boolean-valued Func) of one argument.
member.remarks: This is a functional interface whose functional method is Invoke(object).
member.typeparam: The type of the input to the predicate.

members.member:
Returns a composed predicate that represents a short-circuiting logical OR of this predicate and another. When evaluating the composed predicate, if this predicate is true, then the other predicate is not evaluated.
The type of the input argument A predicate that will be logically-ORed with this predicate A composed predicate that represents the short-circuiting logical OR of this predicate and the other predicate. public*

Returns a composed predicate that represents a short-circuiting logical AND of this predicate and another. When evaluating the composed predicate, if this predicate is false, then the other predicate is not evaluated.
The type of the input argument A predicate that will be logically-ANDed with this predicate A composed predicate that represents the short-circuiting logical AND of this predicate the other predicate. public*

Returns a predicate that represents the logical negation of this predicate.
A predicate that represents the logical negation of this predicate. public*

Evaluates this predicate on the given argument.
The type of the input argument The input item true if the input argument matches the predicate, otherwise false. public*

Unwrapped Func property which evaluates to boolean.
public*

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.Predicates

member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether a supplied Step delivers an empty result.

member.returns: A predicate that returns true if the supplied step returns an empty result.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.Not``1(Saxon.Api.IPredicate{``0})
member.summary: Return an IPredicate that is the negation of a supplied IPredicate.
member.typeparam: The type of object to which the predicate is applicable
member.param: The supplied predicate
member.returns: A predicate that matches an item if and only if the supplied predicate does not match the item.

member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether a supplied Step delivers a non-empty result.

member.returns: A predicate that returns true if the step returns a non-empty result.

member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether an item is a node with a given namespace URI and local name.
member.param: The required namespace URI: supply a zero-length string to indicate the null namespace
The required local name
member.returns: A predicate that returns true if and only if the supplied item is a node with the given namespace URI and local name.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.HasLocalName(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether an item is a node with a given local name, irrespective of the namespace.
member.param: The required local name
member.returns: A predicate that returns true if and only if the supplied item is a node with the given namespace URI and local name.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.HasNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether an item is a node with a given namespace URI.
member.param: The required namespace URI: supply a zero-length string to identify the null namespace
member.returns: A predicate that returns true if and only if the supplied item is a node with the given namespace URI. If a zero-length string is supplied, the predicate will also match nodes having no name, such as text and comment nodes, and nodes having a local name only, such as namespace and processing-instruction nodes.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.HasAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether an item is an element node with a given attribute (whose name is in no namespace).
member.param: The required attribute name
member.returns: A predicate that returns true if and only if the supplied item is an element having an attribute with the given local name, in no namespace.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.AttributeEq(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether an item is an element node with a given attribute (whose name is in no namespace) whose string value is equal to a given value.
member.param: The required attribute name
The required attribute value
member.returns: A predicate that returns true if and only if the supplied item is an element having an attribute with the given local name, in no namespace, whose string value is equal to the given value.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.Eq(Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue)
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether an atomic value compares equal to a supplied atomic value of a comparable type.
member.param: The atomic value to be compared with
member.returns: A predicate which returns true when applied to a value that is equal to the supplied value under the "is-same-key" comparison rules. (These are the rules used to compare key values in an XDM map. The rules are chosen to be context-free, error-free, and transitive.)

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.Eq(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether the result of applying the XPath string() function to an item is equal to a given string.
member.param: The string being tested
member.returns: A predicate which returns true if the string value of the item being tested is equal to the given string under Java comparison rules for comparing strings.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.Eq``2(Saxon.Api.Step{``0,``1},System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether there is some item in the result of applying a step, whose string value is equal to a given string. For example, Eq(attribute("id"), "foo") matches an element if it has an "id" attribute whose value is "foo".
member.typeparam: The type of the input object to the Step function
The result type after invoking the function
member.param: The step to be evaluated
The string to be compared against the items returned by the step
member.returns: A predicate which returns true if some item selected by the step has as string value equal to the given string.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.MatchesRegex(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether the result of applying the XPath string() function to an item matches a given regular expression.
member.param: The regular expression (this is a Java regular expression, not an XPath regular expression)
member.returns: A predicate which returns true if the string value of the item being tested contains a substring that matches the given regular expression. To test the string in its entirety, use anchors "^" and "$" in the regular expression.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.Some``2(Saxon.Api.Step{``0,``1},Saxon.Api.IPredicate{``1})
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether there is some item in the result of applying a step that satisfies the supplied condition.

remarks.para: For example, some(CHILD, exists(attribute("foo")) matches an element if it has a child element with an attribute whose local name is "foo".
If the step returns an empty sequence the result will always be false.

member.typeparam: The type of the input object to the Step function
The expected result type after invoking the function. The predicate must also be of this type.
member.param: The step to be evaluated
The predicate to be applied to the items returned by the step
member.returns: A predicate which returns true if some item selected by the step satisfies the supplied condition.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Predicates.Every``2(Saxon.Api.Step{``0,``1},Saxon.Api.IPredicate{``1})
member.summary: Obtain a predicate that tests whether every item in the result of applying a step satisfies the supplied condition.

remarks.para: For example, every(CHILD, exists(attribute("foo")) matches an element if each of its child elements has an attribute whose local name is "foo".
If the step returns an empty sequence the result will always be true.

member.typeparam: the type of the input object to the Step function
The expected result type after invoking the function. The predicate must also be of this type.
member.param: The step to be evaluated
The predicate to be applied to the items returned by the step
member.returns: A predicate which returns true if every item selected by the step satisfies the supplied condition.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.Step`2
member.summary: A Step class wraps a delegate method that can be applied to an item to return a XdmValue of items.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Step`2.#ctor(System.Func{`0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`1}})
member.summary: Constructor method to wrap a delegate method.
member.param: Passes a delegate as a Func with encapsulated type XdmItem and the return value IEnumerable of items.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Step`2.Where(Saxon.Api.IPredicate{`1})
member.summary:
Obtain a Step that filters the results of this Step using a supplied Func predicate.
For example, Child.Where(Predicate.IsText()) returns a Step whose effect is to select the text node children of a supplied element or document node.
member.param: The predicate is a Func delegate enapsulating the filter which will be applied to the results of this Step
member.returns: A new Step (that is, a wrapped delegate from one Step of items to another) that filters the results of this step by selecting only the items that satisfy the predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Step`2.Then(Saxon.Api.Step{`1,`1})
member.summary: Obtain a Step that combines the results of this step with the results of another step.
member.param: The step which will be applied to the results of this step
member.returns: A new Step (that is, a function from one IEnumerable of items to another) that performs this step and the next step in turn. The result is equivalent to the IEnumerable method SelectMany() function or the XPath ! operator: there is no sorting of nodes into document order, and no elimination of duplicates.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Step`2.At(System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that selects the Nth item in the results of this step.
member.param: The zero-based index of the item to be selected
member.returns: A new Step (that is, a function from one IEnumerable of items to another) that filters the results of this step by selecting only the items that satisfy the predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Step`2.Cat(Saxon.Api.Step{`0,`1})
member.summary: Obtain a Step that concatenates the results of this Step with the result of another Step applied to the same input item.

remarks.p: For example, Attribute().Cat(Child()) returns a step whose effect is to select the attributes of a supplied element followed by its children.

member.param: The step whose results will be concatenated with the results of this step
member.returns: A new Step (that is, a function from one IEnumerable of items to another) that concatenates the results of applying this step to the input item, followed by the results of applying the other step to the input item.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Step`2.Invoke(`0)
member.summary: Invokes this function to the given argument.
member.param: The function argument
member.returns: The function result.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Step`2.Func
member.summary: The Func property that represents the wrapped delegate method which can be invoked.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.Steps
member.summary: This non-instantiable class provides a number of useful implementations of the Step class which wraps a Func object, used to navigate XDM trees, typically getting the Func property and used as an argument to XdmValue#Select and XdmValue#SelectMany.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Root
member.summary: Obtain a Step that selects the root node of the containing document (which may or may not be a document node). If not a node a wrapped empty sequence is returned.
member.returns: A Step that selects the root node of the containing document.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Ancestor
member.summary: Obtain a Step to navigate from a node to its ancestors, in reverse document order (that is, nearest ancestor first, root node last).
member.returns: A Step that selects all nodes on the ancestor axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Ancestor(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to its ancestor elements having a specified local name, irrespective of the namespace. The nodes are returned in reverse document order (that is, nearest ancestor first, root node last).
member.param: The local name of the ancestors to be selected by the Step, or "*" to select all ancestors that are element nodes
member.returns: A Step, which selects the ancestors of a supplied node that have the required local name.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Ancestor(System.String,System.String)
member.param: The namespace URI of the ancestors to be selected by the Step
The local name of the ancestors to be selected by the Step
member.returns: A Step, which selects the ancestors (at most one) of a supplied node that have the required local name and namespace URI.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Ancestor(Saxon.Api.Predicate{Saxon.Api.XdmItem})
member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the nodes found on the ancestor axis using a supplied Predicate. Nodes are returned in reverse document order (that is, nearest ancestor first, root node last).
member.remarks: The function call Ancestor(predicate) is equivalent to Ancestor.Where(predicate).
member.param: The predicate to be applied
member.returns: A Step that filters the nodes found on the ancestor-or-self axis using the supplied predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.AncestorOrSelf
member.summary: Obtain a Step to navigate from a node to its ancestors, in reverse document order, with the node itself returned at the start of the sequence (that is, origin node first, root node last).
member.returns: A Step that selects all nodes on the ancestor-or-self axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.AncestorOrSelf(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to its ancestor elements having a specified local name, irrespective of the namespace. The nodes are returned in reverse document order (that is, nearest ancestor first, root node last), and include the node itself.
member.param: The local name of the ancestors to be selected by the Step, or "*" to select all ancestor-or-self nodes that are element nodes
member.returns: A Step, which selects the ancestors-or-self of a supplied node that have the required local name.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.AncestorOrSelf(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to its ancestors-or-self having a specified namespace URI and local name, in reverse document order (that is, nearest ancestor first, root node last).
member.param: The namespace URI of the ancestors to be selected by the Step: supply a zero-length string to indicate the null namespace
The local name of the ancestors to be selected by the Step
member.returns: A Step, which selects the ancestors-or-self of a supplied node that have the required local name and namespace URI.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.AncestorOrSelf(Saxon.Api.Predicate{Saxon.Api.XdmItem})
member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the nodes found on the ancestor-or-self axis using a supplied Predicate. Nodes are returned in reverse document order (that is, origin node first, root node last).

member.param: The predicate to be applied
member.returns: A Step that filters the nodes found on the ancestor-or-self axis using a supplied predicate.

member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the nodes found on the child axis using a supplied Predicate. The function call Child(predicate) is equivalent to Child.Where(predicate). For example, Child(IsElement()) returns a Step that selects the element node children of a given node.
member.param: The predicate to be applied
member.returns: A Step that filters the nodes found on the child axis using the supplied predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Descendant
member.summary: Obtain a Step to navigate from a node to its descendants, which are returned in document order.
member.returns: A Step that selects all nodes on the descendant axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Descendant(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to the descendant elements having a specified local name, irrespective of the namespace. These are returned in document order.
member.param: The local name of the descendant elements to be selected by the Step, or "*" to select all descendants that are element nodes
member.returns: A Step, which selects the element descendants of a supplied node that have the required local name.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Descendant(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to the descendant elements having a specified namespace URI and local name.

The local name of the elements to be selected by the Step
member.returns: A Step, which selects the element descendants of a supplied node that have the required local name and namespace URI.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Descendant(Saxon.Api.IPredicate{Saxon.Api.XdmNode})
member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the nodes found on the descendant axis using a supplied Predicate. The function call Descendant(predicate) is equivalent to Descendant.Where(predicate). For example, Steps.Descendant(Predicates.IsElement()) returns a Step that selects the element node descendants of a given node, while Descendant(Predicate.Exists(attribute("id"))) selects those that have an attribute named "id". These are returned in document order.
member.param: The predicate to be applied
member.returns: A Step that filters the nodes found on the descendant axis using the supplied predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.DescendantOrSelf
member.summary: Obtain a Step to navigate from a node to its descendants, which are returned in document order, preceded by the origin node itself.
member.returns: A Step that selects all nodes on the descendant-or-self axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.DescendantOrSelf(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to the descendant-or-self elements having a specified local name, irrespective of the namespace. These are returned in document order.
member.param: The local name of the descendant-or-self elements to be selected by the Step, or "*" to select all descendant-or-self that are element nodes
member.returns: A Step, which selects the descendant-or-self elements of a supplied node that have the required local name.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.DescendantOrSelf(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to the descendant-or-self elements having a specified namespace URI and local name.

The local name of the elements to be selected by the Step
member.returns: A Step, which selects the descendant-or-self elements of a supplied node that have the required local name and namespace URI.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.DescendantOrSelf(Saxon.Api.IPredicate{Saxon.Api.XdmNode})
member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the nodes found on the descendant-or-self axis using a supplied Predicate. The function call DescendantOrSelf(predicate) is equivalent to DescendantOrSelf.Where(predicate). For example, Steps.DescendantOrSelf(Predicates.IsElement()) returns a Step that selects the descendant-or-self element nodes of a given node, while DescendantOrSelf(Predicate.Exists(attribute("id"))) selects those that have an attribute named "id". These are returned in document order.
member.param: The predicate to be applied
member.returns: A Step that filters the nodes found on the descendant-or-self axis using the supplied predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Following(Saxon.Api.Predicate{Saxon.Api.XdmItem})

For example, FollowingSibling(IsElement()) returns a Step that selects the following sibling elements of a given node, while FollowingSibling(Exists(Attribute("id"))) selects those that have an attribute named "id". member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Namespace
member.summary: Obtain a Step to navigate from a node to its namespace nodes.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Namespace(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to its namespaces having a specified local name. The local name of a namespace node corresponds to the prefix used in the namespace binding.

member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the nodes found on the namespace axis using a supplied Predicate. The function call Namespace(predicate) is equivalent to Namespace().Where(predicate). For example, Namespace(Eq("http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform") selects a namespace node that binds a prefix to the XSLT namespace.
member.param: The predicate to be applied
member.returns: A Step that filters the nodes found on the namespace axis using the supplied predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Parent
member.summary: Obtain a Step to navigate from a node to its parent.

member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to the parent element provided it has a specified local name, irrespective of the namespace.

For example, Parent(Predicate.IsElement()).GetFunc returns a Step that selects the parent node provided it is an element
member.param: The predicate to be applied
member.returns: A Step that filters the nodes found on the parent axis using the supplied predicate.

member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the nodes found on the preceding sibling axis using a supplied Predicate. The function call PrecedingSibling(predicate) is equivalent to PrecedingSibling().Where(predicate). For example, PrecedingSibling(isElement()) returns a Step that selects the preceding sibling elements of a given node, while PrecedingSibling(Predicate.Exists(attribute("id"))) selects those that have an attribute named "id". member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Preceding(Saxon.Api.Predicate{Saxon.Api.XdmItem})
member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the nodes found on the preceding axis using a supplied Predicate . The function call Preceding(predicate) is equivalent to Preceding().Where(predicate). For example, Preceding(isElement()) returns a Step that selects the preceding elements of a given node, while Preceding(Predicate.Exists(attribute("id"))) selects those that have an attribute named "id". member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Self

member.summary: Obtain a Step that navigates from a node to itself provided it is an element with a specified local name, irrespective of the namespace.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Self(Saxon.Api.Predicate{Saxon.Api.XdmNode})
member.summary: Obtain a Step that filters the node found on the self axis using a supplied Predicate filter. The function call Self(predicate) is equivalent to Self().Where(predicate). For example, self(isElement()) returns a Step that selects the supplied node provided it is an element.
member.param: The predicate to be applied
member.returns: A Step that filters the nodes found on the self axis using the supplied predicate.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Atomize
member.summary: Obtain an selector that atomizes an item to produce a XdmValue of atomic values. Atomizing a node will usually produce a single atomic value, but in the case of schema-typed nodes using a list type, there may be more than one atomic value. Atomizing an array also returns multiple atomic values.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Text
member.summary: Obtain a Step that returns text nodes found on the child axis. The function call Text() is equivalent to Child().Where(Predicate.IsText).
member.returns: A Step that returns the text nodes found on the child axis.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.Tokenize
member.summary: Obtain a Step whose effect is to tokenize the supplied item on whitespace boundaries, returning a sequence of strings as XdmAtomicValue instances.

remarks.p: Note: the tokenize step, when applied to a string with leading and trailing whitespace, has the effect of removing this whitespace. In addition to its primary role, the function can therefore be useful for trimming the content of a single string.

member.returns: A Step whose effect is to take a supplied item and split its string value into a sequence of xs:string instances

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.id(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Obtain a Step whose effect is to interpret the supplied item as an xs:ID value and return the nodes (in a given document) that have that string as their ID.
member.param: The root node (document node) of the document within which the ID value should be sought
member.returns: A Step whose effect is to return the nodes that have the given string as their ID.

member.summary: Construct a path as a composite Step from a sequence of steps composed together.
member.param: The constituent steps in the path
member.returns: A composite step.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Steps.PathFromList(System.Collections.Generic.List{Saxon.Api.Step{Saxon.Api.XdmNode,Saxon.Api.XdmNode}})
member.summary: Construct a path as a composite Step from a list of steps composed together.
member.param: The constituent steps in the path
member.returns: A composite step.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager
member.summary: A SchemaManager is responsible for compiling schemas and maintaining a cache of compiled schemas that can be used for validating instance documents.

remarks.para: To obtain a SchemaManager, use the SchemaManager property of the Processor object.
In a schema-aware Processor there is exactly one SchemaManager (in a non-schema-aware Processor there is none).

The cache of compiled schema definitions can include only one schema component (for example a type, or an element declaration) with any given name. An attempt to compile two different schemas in the same namespace will usually therefore fail.

As soon as a type definition or element declaration is used for the first time in a validation episode, it is marked as being "sealed": this prevents subsequent modifications to the component. Examples of modifications that are thereby disallowed include adding to the substitution group of an existing element declaration, adding subtypes to an existing type, or redefining components using <xs:redefine>.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.SetErrorList(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Saxon.Api.XmlProcessingError})
member.summary: List of errors. The caller may supply an empty list before calling Compile; the processor will then populate the list with error information obtained during the schema compilation. Each error will be included as an object of type StaticError. If no error list is supplied by the caller, error information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: By supplying a custom List with a user-written add() method, it is possible to intercept error conditions as they occur.
Note that this error list is used only for errors detected during the compilation of the schema. It is not used for errors detected when using the schema to validate a source document.

member.param: Supplied list.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.GetErrorList
member.summary: Get list of errors as IList<XmlProcessingError>

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Compile(System.IO.Stream,System.Uri)
member.summary: Compile a schema supplied as a Stream. The resulting schema components are added to the cache.
member.param: A stream containing the source text of the schema. This method will consume the supplied stream. It is the caller's responsibility to close the stream after use.
The base URI of the schema document, for resolving any references to other schema documents

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Compile(System.Uri)
member.summary: Compile a schema, retrieving the source using a URI. The resulting schema components are added to the cache.
member.remarks: The document located via the URI is parsed using the System.Xml parser.
member.param: The URI identifying the location where the schema document can be found

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Compile(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Compile a schema, delivered using an XmlReader. The resulting schema components are added to the cache.
member.remarks: The XmlReader is responsible for parsing the document; this method builds a tree representation of the document (in an internal Saxon format) and compiles it. The XmlReader is used as supplied; it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that its settings are appropriate for parsing a schema document (for example, that entity references are expanded and whitespace is retained).
member.param: The XmlReader (that is, the XML parser) used to supply the source schema document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Compile(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Compile a schema document, located at an XdmNode. This may be a document node whose child is an xs:schema element, or it may be the xs:schema element itself. The resulting schema components are added to the cache.
member.param: The document node or the outermost element node of a schema document.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.NewSchemaValidator
member.summary: Create a new SchemaValidator, which may be used for validating instance documents.

remarks.para: The SchemaValidator uses the cache of schema components held by the SchemaManager. It may also add new components to this cache (for example, when the instance document references a schema using xsi:schemaLocation). It is also affected by changes to the schema cache that occur after the SchemaValidator is created.

When schema components are used for validating instance documents (or for compiling schema-aware queries and stylesheets) they are sealed to prevent subsequent modification. The modifications disallowed once a component is sealed include adding to the substitution group of an element declaration, adding subtypes derived by extension to an existing complex type, and use of <xs:redefine>.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.GetAtomicType(Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Factory method to get an AtomicType object representing the atomic type with a given QName.
member.remarks: It is undefined whether two calls on this method supplying the same QName will return the same XdmAtomicType object instance.
member.param: The QName of the required type
member.returns: An AtomicType object representing this type if it is present in this schema (and is an atomic type); otherwise, null.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.XsdVersion
member.summary: The version of the W3C XML Schema Specification handled by this SchemaManager.

remarks.para: The value must be "1.0" (indicating XML Schema 1.0) or "1.1" (indicating XML Schema 1.1). The default is "1.0". New constructs defined in XSD 1.1 are rejected unless this property is set to "1.1" before compiling the schema.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Catalog
member.summary: This property provides a way to set the catalog file which will be used by the Apache catalog resolver.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.SchemaResolver
member.summary: The SchemaResolver is a user-supplied class used for resolving references to schema documents. It applies to references from one schema document to another appearing in xs:import, xs:include, and xs:redefine; to references from an instance document to a schema in xsi:schemaLocation and xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation, to xsl:import-schema in XSLT, and to the import schema declaration in XQuery.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.ErrorList
member.summary: List of errors. The caller may supply an empty list before calling Compile; the processor will then populate the list with error information obtained during the schema compilation. Each error will be included as an object of type StaticError. If no error list is supplied by the caller, error information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: By supplying a custom List with a user-written add() method, it is possible to intercept error conditions as they occur.
Note that this error list is used only for errors detected during the compilation of the schema. It is not used for errors detected when using the schema to validate a source document.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.ErrorReporter
member.summary: Set the ErrorReporter to be used when validating instance documents as a user defined ErrorReporter. If this property is used then the ErrorList property and SetErrorList method is overriden
member.remarks: The IErrorReporter to be used

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator
member.summary: A SchemaValidator is an object that is used for validating instance documents against a schema. The schema consists of the collection of schema components that are available within the schema cache maintained by the SchemaManager, together with any additional schema components located during the course of validation by means of an xsl:schemaLocation or xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation attribute within the instance document.
member.remarks: If validation fails, an exception is thrown. If validation succeeds, the validated document can optionally be written to a specified destination. This will be a copy of the original document, augmented with default values for absent elements and attributes, and carrying type annotations derived from the schema processing. Saxon does not deliver the full PSVI as described in the XML schema specifications, only the subset of the PSVI properties featured in the XDM data model.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetValidityReporting(Saxon.Api.XmlDestination)
member.summary: Set the validation reporting feature, which saves the validation errors in an XML file
member.param: destination where XML will be sent

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetInvalidityHandler(Saxon.Api.IInvalidityHandler)
member.summary: Set the InvalidityHandler to be used when validating instance documents
member.param: the InvalidityHandler to be used

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.AddSource(System.IO.Stream,System.Uri)
member.summary: Add an instance document to the list of documents to be validated.
member.param: Source document supplied as a Stream
Base URI of the source document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.AddSource(System.Uri)
member.summary: Add an instance document to the list of documents to be validated
member.param: URI of the source document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.AddSource(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Add an instance document to the list of documents to be validated
member.param: Source document supplied as an XmlReader

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.AddSource(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Add an instance document to the list of documents to be validated.
member.param: Source document supplied as an XdmNode value

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetSource(System.IO.Stream,System.Uri)
member.summary: Supply the instance document to be validated in the form of a Stream
member.param: A stream containing the XML document to be parsed and validated. This stream will be consumed by the validation process, but it will not be closed after use: that is the responsibility of the caller.
The base URI to be used for resolving any relative references, for example a reference to an xsi:schemaLocation

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetSource(System.Uri)
member.summary: Supply the instance document to be validated in the form of a Uri reference
member.param: URI of the document to be validated

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetSource(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Supply the instance document to be validated, in the form of an XmlReader.
member.remarks: The XmlReader is responsible for parsing the document; this method validates it.
member.param: The XmlReader used to read and parse the instance document being validated. This is used as supplied. For conformance, use of a plain XmlTextReader is discouraged, because it does not expand entity references. This may cause validation failures.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetSource(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Supply the instance document to be validated in the form of an XdmNode.

remarks.para: The supplied node must be either a document node or an element node. If an element node is supplied, then the subtree rooted at this element is validated as if it were a complete document: that is, it must not only conform to the structure required of that element, but any referential constraints (keyref, IDREF) must be satisfied within that subtree.

member.param: The document or element node at the root of the tree to be validated

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetDestination(Saxon.Api.XmlDestination)
member.summary: Supply the destination to hold the validated document. If no destination is supplied, the validated document is discarded.
member.remarks: The destination differs from the source in that (a) default values of missing elements and attributes are supplied, and (b) the typed values of elements and attributes are available. However, typed values can only be accessed if the result is represented using the XDM data model, that is, if the destination is supplied as an XdmDestination.
member.param: The destination to hold the validated document.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.Close
member.summary: Close the destination, allowing resources to be released. Saxon calls this method when it has finished writing to the destination

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetParameter(Saxon.Api.QName,Saxon.Api.XdmValue)
member.summary: Set the value of a schema parameter (a parameter defined in the schema using the saxon:param extension)
member.param: the name of the schema parameter, as a QName
the value of the schema parameter, or null to clear a previously set value

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.GetParameter(Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Get the value that has set for a schema processor (a parameter defined in the schema using the saxon:param extension)
member.param: the parameter whose name is required
member.returns: the value that has been set for the parameter, or the EmptySequence if no value has been set

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.Run
member.summary: Run the validation of the supplied source document, optionally writing the validated document to the supplied destination.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.IsLax
member.summary: The validation mode may be either strict or lax. The default is strict; this property is set to indicate that lax validation is required. With strict validation, validation fails if no element declaration can be located for the outermost element. With lax validation, the absence of an element declaration results in the content being considered valid.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.UseXsiSchemaLocation
member.summary: This property defines whether the schema processor will recognize, and attempt to dereference, any xsi:schemaLocation and xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation attributes encountered in the instance document. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.DocumentElementName
member.summary: The name of the required top-level element of the document to be validated (that is, the name of the outermost element of the document). if no value is supplied, there is no constraint on the required type

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.DocumentElementTypeName
member.summary: The name of the required type of the top-level element of the document to be validated. QName of the name of the required type of the document element, or null if no value has been set. If no value is supplied, there is no constrin on the required type

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.ExpendAttributeDefaults
member.summary: Ask and set whether attribute defaults defined in a schema are to be expanded or not (by default, fixed and default attribute values are expaned, that is, they are inserted) into the document during validation as if they were present in the instance being validated)

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.ErrorList
member.summary: List of errors. The caller may supply an empty list before calling Compile; the processor will then populate the list with error information obtained during the schema compilation. Each error will be included as an object of type StaticError. If no error list is supplied by the caller, error information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: By supplying a custom List with a user-written add() method, it is possible to intercept error conditions as they occur.
Note that this error list is used only for errors detected while using the schema to validate a source document. It is not used to report errors in the schema itself.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.SchemaResolver
member.summary: The SchemaResolver is a user-supplied class used for resolving references to schema documents. It applies to references from one schema document to another appearing in xs:import, xs:include, and xs:redefine; to references from an instance document to a schema in xsi:schemaLocation and xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation, to xsl:import-schema in XSLT, and to the import schema declaration in XQuery.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmItemType
member.summary: Abstract class representing an item type. This may be the generic item type item(), an atomic type, the generic node type node(), a specific node kind such as element() or text(), or the generic function type function().
member.remarks: More specific node types (such as element(E) or schema-element(E)) cannot currently be instantiated in this API.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmItemType.Matches(Saxon.Api.XdmItem)
member.summary: Determine whether this item type matches a given item.
member.param: the item to be tested against this item type
member.returns: true if the item matches this item type, false if it does not match.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmItemType.Subsumes(Saxon.Api.XdmItemType)
member.summary: Determine whether this ItemType subsumes another ItemType. Specifically, A.subsumes(B) is true if every value that matches the ItemType B also matches the ItemType A.
member.param: the other ItemType
member.returns: true if this ItemType subsumes the other ItemType. This includes the case where A and B represent the same ItemType.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmItemType.ToString
member.summary: Get a string representation of the type. This will be a string that confirms to XPath ItemType production, for example a QName (always in 'Q{uri}local' format, or a construct such as 'node()' or 'map(*)'). If the type is an anonymous schema type, the name of the nearest named base type will be given, preceded by the character '<'
member.returns: a string representation of the type

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicType
member.summary: An instance of class XdmAtomicType represents a specific atomic type, for example xs:double, xs:integer, or xs:anyAtomicType. This may be either a built-in atomic type or a type defined in a user-written schema.
member.remarks: To get an XdmAtomicType instance representing a built-in atomic type, use one of the predefined instances of the subclass XdmBuiltInAtomicType. To get an XdmAtomicType instance representing a user-defined atomic type (defined in a schema), use the method GetAtomicType defined on the SchemaManager class.
